nav.div: Warrensburg Central School » District » COVID-19 Coronavirus Updates and Information

span.span: Per the Governor's Executive Order, the closure of New York State public schools is extended until April 29, 2020.

br.span: Please keep checking this page for updates and the latest information.

span.a: Friday, April 17, Message from the Superintendent
Monday, April 6, Message from the Superintendent

p.style: margin: 0px; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;
margin: 0px; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: center;
p.span: Warren County is putting technology into place that will allow the streaming of regular Health & Safety Briefings to the general public. Please visit our main page (https://www.warrencountyny.gov/) and click the button that says “Click here to sign up for COVID-19 Updates.”

span.a: NYSED Information and Guidance for Schools
New York State Department of Health

a.title: Center for Disease Control and Prevention

a.title: What to do if you are sick

span.a: What to do if you are sick with COVID-19

p.span:
Please visit our Social Emotional Support Page»
Below you will also find a list of social & emotional resources to take a look at in regards to coronavirus.

span.a: Talking with kids about the Coronavirus»
Talking with children about COVID-19(Coronavirus): A parent resource»

p.span:
If you have any questions in regards to these resources, members of our staff can assist you. Please contact:
School Counselor, Jessica Mossing - mossingj@wcsd.org
School Counselor, Sarah Landers - landerss@wcsd.org
Elementary School Social Worker, Kate Motsiff - motsiffk@wcsd.org
Jr/Sr High School Social Worker, John Friauf - friaufj@wcsd.org
School Psychologist Sarah Quereau - quereaus@wcsd.org

span.span: Beginning Monday, March 16, Charter will offer free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and/or college students who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription at any service level up to 100 Mbps. To learn more and enroll, visit their website.
